definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: We don't change things out of personal prejudice.
sentences.chinese: 不要因为个人成见而改变事物的本来面目。

sentences.english: Raj: Can you even open your mouth without spewing a cultural stereotype?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么每次一张嘴吐出来的全是文化成见呢？

sentences.english: The English are, as often as not, labeled conservative. Obviously this label is prejudiced.
sentences.chinese: 英国人常常被回类为守旧型，显然这一回类带有成见。

sentences.english: There is no prejudice in their heart.
sentences.chinese: 悠游卒岁，心中并无固定的成见。

sentences.english: And an increasing number of girls are enjoying the chance to challenge preconceptions.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女孩也想利用这个机会挑战社会成见。

sentences.english: This also eliminates the I in Shanghai people cheat strangers and xenophobic stereotypes.
sentences.chinese: 从此也消除了我对上海人欺生和排外的成见。

sentences.english: His judgement was uncoloured by personal prejudice.
sentences.chinese: 他的判断并不带有个人成见。

sentences.english: In martial arts, to be like wind means to adapt to circumstances without pre-conceptions.
sentences.chinese: 在武术里，如风意味着无成见地适应环境。

sentences.english: Less prejudice makes your life expansive.
Overcoming these stereotypes, then, has to begin with a sense of curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 要消除这些成见，首先要有一定的求知欲。

sentences.english: Teachers tend to have stereotyped opinions about naughty pupils.
sentences.chinese: 教师往往对调皮学生抱有成见。

sentences.english: But even at schools like MUC, stereotypes can also be misleading.
sentences.chinese: 但即便是在民大，成见依然可能会导致误解。

sentences.english: In his view, the stereotypes that separate body and soul is completely wrong.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，那种灵肉分离的成见是完全错误的。

sentences.english: Markets have moods and biases that need to be counterbalanced.
sentences.chinese: 市场喜怒无常且有成见和偏爱，需要予以制衡。

sentences.english: Therefore, religious school of their prejudices and traditions of stickle for the.
sentences.chinese: 因此宗教学派们为成见和传统所拘泥。

definition: hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
a matter that gnaws at one's mind/preoccupation/sore point/rancor
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
